poem:
### Summit Morning

In the east, an engine  
breathes fire and soot—  
Putin arrives; the papers crunch.  
Smoke whispers over  
the Krasnodar sky,  
like autumn leaves,  
untangling stories  
without sound.  
Syzygy of flight,  
the unseen hands—  
as yet unturned,  
a summit  
of drifting wings.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Vladimir Putin arrives in China for security summit – Ukraine war live 11.48am BST The Ukrainian military said that it had struck Russian oil refineries in Krasnodar and Syzran overnight. The military recorded multiple explosions and a fire at the Krasnodar oil refinery in Russia’s south and said there was also a fire in the Syzran oil refinery area in Samara region. Russian authorities in Krasnodar said falling drone debris damaged one of the refinery’s". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
